page.title: 13FUND RAISING BIKE RIDES
page.content: A Weasenham family sadly lost their youngest member last year. He died at the age of 10 months.In his memory, his sisters, brother and parents have been raising money for the Child Care Cancer Fund based at Great Ormond street, London.A successful village fete was held. This was organised and run by the children with their parents help. A sponsored cycle ride to Swaffham and back (aprox 20 miles) was undertaken by 38 members of the family and friends.Everyone completed the journey including the youngest, aged 5,the baby's brother.A spectator in Swaffham was so impressed to see him he gave him Â£2 on the spot.The baby's grand parents have held another fete in Dereham and funds raised so far are in the region of Â£2,000.The children hope to make the bike ride an annual event.
